title: Space 4.0 – is there space for Sweden in the new space era?
description: From early astronomy to space exploration, we have reached Space 4.0, an era where space technology is vital for a multitude of services and affects business, academia and global interaction. ESA has defined Space 4.0 as a new playing field. What will be Sweden’s position in the new Space era?
extendedDescription:
From the early astronomers to space exploration, we are now living in Space 4.0, the era where space technology is vital for a multitude of services and something that affects business, academia and global interaction. ESA has defined Space 4.0 as an era characterized by a new playing field, unfolding interaction between governments, private sector, society and politics. New technology, new actors and new initiatives are redrawing the global space-arena. Sweden is a space nation with a strong heritage within industry as well as academia. But the space sector is undergoing a rapid development. Does the Swedish space sector stand up to this challenge? Can Swedish companies, engineers and scientists be competitive in the new space era?   
Listen to the perspectives of the European Space Agency, The Swedish space authorities, politicians and the Swedish space industry.
